links.title: The Apple iPhone 'Supercycle' Is Dead, But That May Be Great for Investors
links.description: Death to the notion of an Apple ( AAPL) iPhone 'supercycle' may be a good thing for the tech giant's investors. Ahead of Apple's Sept. 2017 unveil of the $1,000 iPhone X, Wall Street was abuzz with a 'supercycle' -- mass numbers of people quickly upgrading to an entirely new iPhone -- leading to big sales and profit gains.

links.title: Apple's Pious Privacy Pledges Ring Hollow
links.description: Privacy is the new battleground. Sounds simple, but it's not. This war is really about the power of networks, and legacy versus disruption. The Wall Street Journal reported Facebook ( FB) pulled its iPhone data security app last week, after Apple ( AAPL) ruled the service violated its data collection policy.
